metadata.Title: CVE-2021-31826 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
Shibboleth Service Provider 3.x before 3.2.2 is prone to a NULL pointerdereference flaw involving the session recovery feature. The flaw isexploitable (for a daemon crash) on systems not using this feature if acrafted cookie is supplied.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-31826` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-shib - 3.0.4+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.2
libapache2-mod-shib2 - 3.0.4+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.2
libshibsp-plugins - 3.0.4+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.2
libshibsp8 - 3.0.4+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.2
shibboleth-sp-common - 3.0.4+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.2
shibboleth-sp-utils - 3.0.4+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.2
shibboleth-sp2-common - 3.0.4+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.2
shibboleth-sp2-utils - 3.0.4+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: shibboleth-sp package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.0.4+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.2').
